intro: Pteroloma auriculatum, commonly known as the auriculate pteroloma, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
